definition: Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: The fifth chapter is to discuss the reception of ChuCi in Liu Xizai' poem–ode.
sentences.chinese: 第五章，論劉熙載詩賦對楚辭的接受。

sentences.english: When had been Elegies of Chu transmit into Japan?
sentences.chinese: 楚辭何時傳進日本，沒有明確記錄。

sentences.english: The description of inhabiting environment and architecture is very romantic and various.
sentences.chinese: “楚辭”中對人居環境與建築的描寫宏富浪漫多彩。

sentences.english: The sixth chapter is to discuss the Criterion of ChuCi about Liu Xizai reviewing Ci.
sentences.chinese: 第六章，論劉熙載評鑑詞的楚辭尺度。

sentences.english: Back in Oxford Hawkes completed his doctoral dissertation on The Songs of the South.
sentences.chinese: 回到牛津後，霍克思完成了他的博士論文《論楚辭》。

sentences.english: That is the reason for Li He's acceptance of Chuci.
sentences.chinese: 李賀對楚辭的接受也包括這兩個方面。

sentences.english: Elegies of Chu nourished Han Fu and had deep and lasting influence on the later literature.
sentences.chinese: 楚辭滋養了漢賦，並對後世文學產生了深遠的影響。

sentences.english: The Songs of Chu" is the essence of marvellous Chu culture."
sentences.chinese: 楚辭”是奇譎瑰麗的楚文化的精華。

sentences.english: Both Zhuang Zi and Chu Ci are important documents of the Warring States Period.
sentences.chinese: 《莊子》《楚辭》是戰國中期兩部重要文獻。

sentences.english: It's difficult to understand Chuci, and there are not exact explications to some parts of it today.
sentences.chinese: 《楚辭》歷來難懂，很多地方至今未有確解。

sentences.english: Songyu's Jiubian realized the change of the subject of Chuci.
sentences.chinese: 宋玉的《九辯》實現了楚辭主題的轉換。

sentences.english: This series of book is the modern paraphrases by Wen Huaisha, the expert of Songs of Chu.
sentences.chinese: 諸書爲楚辭專家文懷沙對屈原作品的今繹。

sentences.english: The rich witchcraft of the nation is the original religion background for the formation of the artistic characteristics of the Songs of Chu .
sentences.chinese: 楚國濃郁的巫風是楚辭藝術特徵形成的原始宗教背景。

definition: Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
On Encountering Sorrow, poem by Qu Yuan 屈原[Qu1 Yuan2] in Songs of Chu 楚辭|楚辞[Chu3 ci2]
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
"Strategies of the Warring States", chronicle of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), possibly written by Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2]
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
Tang poetry/a Tang poem
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
teacher/one's teacher
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds
homesick
compilation/selected works
beginning/origin/to originate/to initiate
